title: Ethereum May Exponentially Outperform Bitcoin in Coming Cycle, According to Macro Guru Raoul Pal - The Daily Hodl
summary: Ethereum may significantly outperform Bitcoin in the upcoming cycle, according to Raoul Pal, a macro guru and CEO of Real Vision. The ETH/BTC chart is forming a wedge, and a breakout could lead to a rally that makes Ethereum 1-5 times more valuable than Bitcoin. Pal believes Ethereum's larger total addressable market and broader use cases make it a more attractive investment than Bitcoin. At time of writing, Ethereum is worth $1,758.

title: Amount of Destroyed Ethereum (ETH) Reaches 66,000 in 2023, Here's What's Next - U.Today
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

🚀 Ethereum burn rate reaches 66,000 coins in 2023, worth $117M.
🔥 EIP-1559 implemented in August 2021 introduced base fee mechanism, burning transaction fees.
📈 Reduction in supply due to burn rate combined with increasing demand may drive Ethereum price higher.
🔍 Burn rate can fluctuate based on network activity, gas fees, and Ethereum 2.0 transition.
💰 Total amount of destroyed coins surpasses 66,000 ETH, making Ethereum increasingly scarce.
📈 Market dynamics may evolve with potential for higher prices due to reduced supply.
💡 Investors and traders should monitor developments in Ethereum ecosystem and burn rate factors.

title: National Australia Bank Concludes Cross-Border Trade Using Ethereum Blockchain Based Stablecoin - CoinTrust
summary: National Australia Bank (NAB) successfully executed an intra-bank cross-border trade using its own stablecoin on the Ethereum blockchain, marking a significant milestone in the adoption of blockchain technology in the financial services industry. The trade demonstrated the potential to significantly reduce the duration and cost of international transactions, benefiting NAB's corporate and institutional customers who conduct business across multiple jurisdictions and currencies. NAB plans to fully support its Australian stablecoin, AUDN, with the Australian dollar and administer it as a bank obligation, and by the end of the year, it aims to assist selected customers with digital asset transactions. The bank partnered with Blockfold and Fireblocks to develop and launch its stablecoins on the Ethereum blockchain, leveraging their expertise in smart contracts, stablecoin creation and destruction, and blockchain custody. The successful execution of the trade is seen as a significant step towards the transformation of the financial services industry from Web2 to Web3, supported by blockchain technology and strong regulatory oversight.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Creator Vitalik Buterin Outlines Favorite Crypto Security Strategy - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum creator Vitalik Buterin recommends using multisig wallets for crypto security, which requires multiple signatures for transactions. He also suggests having a network of trusted individuals or devices, called "guardians," to help recover funds in case of compromise. Buterin uses a multisig wallet personally and at the Ethereum Foundation, and his rule of thumb is to have enough guardians controlled by other people to recover funds in case of disappearance.

title: Grayscale: focus on the Ethereum PoW crypto - The Cryptonomist
summary: Grayscale, a crypto investment firm, is considering acquiring Ethereum PoW (ETHW) tokens after extending the review period for evaluating the market environment. The decision comes amid regulatory uncertainty and market volatility. Grayscale is taking a cautious approach, recognizing the potential risks and uncertainties in the market. The decision to extend the review period may signal a change in the way institutional investors approach the cryptocurrency market, potentially becoming more risk-averse.
